Corrigendum 
 
Reference:- AVSEC  Circular no. 34/2005 dated 22.8.2005 
Subject :- 
Screening of  Hold Baggage 
      In partial  modification of this  Bureau  AVSEC  Circular no. 34/2005 dated 
22.8.2005,  Para  No.5  pertaining to  Transfer   Baggage  may  be replaced with 
the  following  para: 
“5.   
Transfer hold baggage: Transfer hold baggage of International flights 
shall be  subjected to the same security procedures as given in this Circular for 
originating accompanied hold baggage  prior to being loaded onto an aircraft 
engaged in commercial air transport operations,  unless a validation  process has 
been established and procedures are continuously implemented by India in 
collaboration with other contracting states where appropriate, to ensure that  
such hold  baggage  has been screened at the  point of  origin and  subsequently  
protected  from  unauthorized interference from the originating airport to 
departing aircraft at the  transfer  airport. In  the case of  domestic  operations, 
transfer  hold  baggage may not  be screened as  the same  has been  subjected 
to screening   at the point of  origin being a  mandatory  requirement  at  all 
airports  in India.” 
 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS)
